channel.description: Recent content in Colour on JacksBlog

item.title: HDR Image Formats (V): Understanding Headroom in Gainmap
item.description: Through a case study, understand a seemingly redundant parameter when encoding HDR images: the role of Alternate HDR Headroom in the ISO 21496-1 standard

item.title: A First Look at Mobile Phone Log: OPPO Log as an Example
item.description: Are Log video on Android a professional tool or just marketing? The technical details of OPPO Log curve and examines its performance through two examples.

item.title: Geekon Monitor Unboxing: High-end Aspiration, Workshop Reality
item.description: High specs, high price, and high-end looks, but not quite high-end. This Geekon monitor boasts a 6K panel, 92% BT.2020 color gamut, and 20 luminance.

item.title: Decoding an Adaptive HDR Tone Mapping Method (Wang, 2025)
item.description: Adaptive HDR-to-SDR tone mapping for 0-1000 nits HDR to SDR. Uses max RGB luminance, tone compression, detail and dark enhancement. Wang et al. (2025).

item.title: MacAdam's Optimal Colours: The Boundary of Physical Colours
item.description: Explore Schrödinger's theory on the limit of object colors and optimal pigment calculations.

item.title: HDR Image Formats (IV): ISO 21496-1 the Unified Gainmap
item.description: ISO 21496-1 standardizes Gainmap metadata, defining HDR imaging with a universal JPEG APP2 format, unifying previously proprietary formats like UltraHDR.

item.title: A Quick Analysis of the X2D II 100C File Format
item.description: Hasselblad HNCS HDR outputs Ultra HDR JPEG with Gainmap and P3 color via Phocus, the first medium format camera with end-to-end HDR.

item.title: Decoding HDR Image Formats (I): Basic Concepts of Gainmap
item.description: Gainmaps and UltraHDR enhance JPEGs with dual-layer HDR, using a base image and a gainmap with XMP metadata like Min, Max, and Gamma.

item.title: CAT16: Why Are Two Steps Needed to Ensure Reversibility?
item.description: CAT16 model: two-step chromatic adaptation ensures reversibility, unlike one-step methods.

item.title: Objective Test Procedures for Sony Camera Displays
item.description: Learn how to transfer metadata using Exiftool and Pillow to display test images on Sony camera screens for display colorimetry analysis and gamut measurement.

item.title: Principles of Colour Reproduction in Digital Images Notes: Colour Reproduction and Gamut
item.description: Learn color reproduction goals: spectral, colorimetric, perceptual rendering, gamut mapping, intents, and viewing conditions.

item.title: An Experiment to Understand HDR Transfer Functions
item.description: Learn BT.2408 HDR transfer functions, PQ, and HLG with Python—fix 18% grey card luminance issues and master accurate HDR workflows.

item.title: iCAM06: Colour Appearance Model in Image Processing
item.description: iCAM06: HDR rendering with color models & tone compression for accurate display reproduction.

item.title: HDR Image Format Conversion
item.description: Digital images are pixel arrays compressed by JPG with DCT and Huffman coding, accurately displayed via color spaces and formats like TIFF.

item.title: Not Just Colour Difference: Evaluate Image with Colour Chart
item.description: Dive into color analysis: sRGB to CIELAB, DeltaE2000, ISP effects, AE influence, and accuracy in final JPG output. Understand the full imaging pipeline.

item.title: How to Correctly Read RAW Files
item.description: Compare dcraw, Rawpy, and LibRaw for extracting RAW image data. Analyze their support for Sony, Canon, Hasselblad, Fujifilm cameras and 16-bit TIFF demosaicing.

item.title: Reflectance: Another Path to Readability in Bright Environments
item.description: Analyzes the mobile display brightness race, explaining why high-nit specs offer limited practical value and comparing solutions for outdoor readability.

item.title: Reincarnated into the ISP Isekai Day 0: Lost in the RAW Forest, I Summon RGB with a 3x3 Magic Array
item.description: Forge your own ISP from RAW to sRGB using color science, CCM, and gamut mapping—craft a custom processor like a true pixel engineer.

item.title: Colour Space Conversion: RAW to XYZ
item.description: how camera RAW RGB converts to XYZ using CCM, spectral sensitivity, colour matching functions, and tristimulus calculations in colour science.

item.title: Colour Space Conversion: RGB to XYZ
item.description: Build a precise RGB to XYZ matrix using sRGB primaries, white point (0.3127, 0.3290), and the non-linear transfer function for accurate color conversion.

item.title: Principles of Colour Reproduction in Digital Images Notes: Colour Measurement
item.description: Explore color measurement: spectral separation for flexibility, integration for direct tristimulus values. Compare spectrophotometers vs. imaging photometers.

item.title: Principles of Colour Reproduction in Digital Images Notes: Colour Appearance
item.description: CIECAM16 predicts colour appearance across viewing conditions for cross-media reproduction, considering background, light source, and adaptation.

item.title: Principles of Colour Reproduction in Digital Images Notes: Chromatic Adaptation Transform
item.description: Learn chromatic adaptation models (CAT02, CAT16, von Kries) for color constancy—stable color perception under varying lighting in visual science.

item.title: Principles of Colour Reproduction in Digital Images Notes: Illuminants and Light Sources
item.description: Explore black-body radiation theory: ideal thermal emitter properties, Planck's law formula, color temperature, and spectral radiant exitance calculations.

item.title: Principles of Colour Reproduction in Digital Images Notes: Fundamentals of Colorimetry
item.description: Explore quantitative colorimetry: color mixing, CIE systems, CIELAB, CIEDE2000, and Munsell Colour System for color measurement.

item.title: Principles of Colour Reproduction in Digital Images Notes: Light and Vision
item.description: Explore light properties, human eye response, and how the CIE function converts radiometric to photometric units like lumens and lux.

item.title: Principles of Colour Reproduction in Digital Images Notes: Introduction
item.description: Systematic guide to digital color reproduction, colorimetry, and ICC/ACES color management, based on Principles of Colour Reproduction in Digital Images.
